alert.note: Alert for West Central Mountains (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Boise (Southwestern Idaho and Eastern Oregon)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 15 at 6:54PM MDT by NWS Boise
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northwestern Valley and northeastern Adams Counties through 745 PM MDT... At 654 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Council Mountain, or 8 miles southwest of McCall, moving north at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... McCall and Little Payette Lake around 710 PM MDT. New Meadows, Meadows, Brundage Ski Area and Payette Lake around 720 PM MDT. Upper Payette Lake and Pollock Mountain around 740 PM MDT. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
